data.title: Bourges Cathedral
data.text: Bourges Cathedral French Cathdrale Saint tienne de Bourges is a Roman Catholic church located in Bourges France The cathedral is dedicated to Saint Stephen and is the seat of the Archbishop of Bourges Built atop an earlier Romanesque church from 1195 until 1230 it is largely in the Classic Gothic architectural style and was constructed at about the same time as Chartres Cathedral The cathedral is particularly known for the great size and unity of its interior the sculptural decoration of its portals and the large collection of 13th century stained glass windows Owing to its quintessential Gothic architecture the cathedral was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1992
